meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suggestible.
meanings.sent1: Her suggestibilities made her believe everything she heard.
meanings.sent2: His suggestibilities were evident when he quickly agreed to the plan.
meanings.sent3: The suggestibilities of the puppy were on full display when it followed the toy without question.
meanings.sent4: The suggestibilities of the students were like clay in the hands of the skilled teacher.
meanings.sent5: The suggestibilities of the audience were carefully manipulated by the hypnotist.

meanings.definition: The capacity to be influenced or persuaded easily.
meanings.sent1: The politician relied on the suggestibilities of the voters to win the election.
meanings.sent2: Her suggestibilities were taken advantage of by the salesperson.
meanings.sent3: The suggestibilities of the child were tested by the persuasive toy commercials.
meanings.sent4: The suggestibilities of the jury swayed the outcome of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The suggestibilities of the crowd were exploited by the charismatic speaker.
